intro: Salsola radiata, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and disturbed soils. The plant has small, spiny leaves and produces clusters of tiny, greenish flowers that develop into dry, three-lobed fruits. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with deep roots that allow it to survive in low-nutrient soils. Salsola radiata is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively, making it a common invasive species in many regions.
